member.name: T:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IBankAccountsApiSync
member.summary: Represents a collection of functions to interact with the API endpoints

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IBankAccountsApiSync.CreateBankAccount(AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.BankAccountRequestBody)
member.summary: Create Bank Account
member.remarks: Create a **Bank Account** to be used as either a funding source or a Disbursement destination. Store the returned `:id` and use it for a `make_payment` **Item Action** call. The `:id` is also referred to as a `token` when involving **Bank Accounts**.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IBankAccountsApiSync.CreateBankAccountWithHttpInfo(AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.BankAccountRequestBody)
member.summary: Create Bank Account
member.remarks: Create a **Bank Account** to be used as either a funding source or a Disbursement destination. Store the returned `:id` and use it for a `make_payment` **Item Action** call. The `:id` is also referred to as a `token` when involving **Bank Accounts**.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IBankAccountsApiSync.RedactBankAccount(System.String)
member.summary: Redact Bank Account
member.remarks: Redact a **Bank Account** using a given `:id`. Redacted **Bank Accounts** can no longer be used as a funding source or a Disbursement destination.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IBankAccountsApiSync.RedactBankAccountWithHttpInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Redact Bank Account
member.remarks: Redact a **Bank Account** using a given `:id`. Redacted **Bank Accounts** can no longer be used as a funding source or a Disbursement destination.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IBankAccountsApiSync.SendPennyAmount(System.String)
member.summary: Send Penny Amount
member.remarks: When penny verification is enabled, this API call sends two penny transactions to the specified bank account for verification. **Note**: This API call is not required when your platform has automatic penny verification enabled, as this is instead done by the system. Penny credit verification is only supported for US platforms.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IBankAccountsApiSync.SendPennyAmountWithHttpInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Send Penny Amount
member.remarks: When penny verification is enabled, this API call sends two penny transactions to the specified bank account for verification. **Note**: This API call is not required when your platform has automatic penny verification enabled, as this is instead done by the system. Penny credit verification is only supported for US platforms.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.summary: Show Bank Account
member.remarks: Show details of a specific **Bank Account** using a given `:id`.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.summary: Show Bank Account
member.remarks: Show details of a specific **Bank Account** using a given `:id`.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IBankAccountsApiSync.ShowBankAccountUser(System.String)
member.summary: Show Bank Account User
member.remarks: Show the **User** the **Bank Account** is associated with using a given `:id`.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IBankAccountsApiSync.ShowBankAccountUserWithHttpInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Show Bank Account User
member.remarks: Show the **User** the **Bank Account** is associated with using a given `:id`.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IBankAccountsApiSync.ValidateRoutingNumber(System.String)
member.summary: Validate Routing Number
member.remarks: Validate a US bank routing number before creating an account. This can be used to provide on-demand verification, and further information of the bank information a User is providing.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IBankAccountsApiSync.ValidateRoutingNumberWithHttpInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Validate Routing Number
member.remarks: Validate a US bank routing number before creating an account. This can be used to provide on-demand verification, and further information of the bank information a User is providing.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IBankAccountsApiSync.VerifyPennyAmount(System.String,AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.PennyVerifyRequestBody)
member.summary: Verify Penny Amount
member.remarks: When penny verification is enabled, this API call verifies the two penny transactions that were sent to a specified bank account using **Send Penny Amount**. **Note**: This API call requires you to provide a front-end interface to your end-users into which they can input the penny amounts required for a successful verification. Your front-end interface should then pass the information into this API call. Penny credit verification is only supported for US platforms.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IBankAccountsApiSync.VerifyPennyAmountWithHttpInfo(System.String,AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.PennyVerifyRequestBody)
member.summary: Verify Penny Amount
member.remarks: When penny verification is enabled, this API call verifies the two penny transactions that were sent to a specified bank account using **Send Penny Amount**. **Note**: This API call requires you to provide a front-end interface to your end-users into which they can input the penny amounts required for a successful verification. Your front-end interface should then pass the information into this API call. Penny credit verification is only supported for US platforms.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: Cancellation Token to cancel the request.

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.BankAccountsApi.VerifyPennyAmount(System.String,AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.PennyVerifyRequestBody)
member.summary: Verify Penny Amount When penny verification is enabled, this API call verifies the two penny transactions that were sent to a specified bank account using **Send Penny Amount**. **Note**: This API call requires you to provide a front-end interface to your end-users into which they can input the penny amounts required for a successful verification. Your front-end interface should then pass the information into this API call. Penny credit verification is only supported for US platforms.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

Your front-end interface should then pass the information into this API call. Penny credit verification is only supported for US platforms.

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IBatchTransactionsApiSync.ListBatchTransactions(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: List Batch Transactions
member.remarks: Retrieve an ordered and paginated list of existing **Batch Transactions**. The list can be filtered by **Account**, **Batch ID**, **Item**, and **Transaction Type**.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200. (optional, default to 10)
Number of records to offset. Required for pagination. (optional, default to 0)
Bank, Card or Wallet Account ID. (optional)
Batch ID. This appears on a bank reference. (optional)

The type of transaction. Options for querying are: payment, refund, disbursement, fee, deposit, withdrawal. For returned values please refer here: [Enumeration Values](https://developer.assemblypayments.com/docs/enumeration-values) for the full list (optional)

The method the transaction was carried out with. Options for querying are: credit_card, npp, bpay, wire_transfer, wallet_account_transfer, misc. For returned values please refer here: [Enumeration Values](https://developer.assemblypayments.com/docs/enumeration-values) for the full list (optional)
Direction of the transaction. Options are debit, credit (optional)
Date and time in ISO 8601 format the item(s) were created before (e.g. 2020-02-27T23:54:59Z) (optional)
Date and time in ISO 8601 format the item(s) were created after (e.g. 2020-02-27T23:54:59Z) (optional)
The bank used for disbursing the payment. Please use a default value of `any` (optional)
The bank used for processing the payment. Please use a default value of `any` (optional)

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.ICardAccountsApiSync.CreateCardAccount(AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.CardAccountRequestBody)
member.summary: Create Card Account
member.remarks: Create a Credit **Card Account** to be used as a funding source. Store the returned `:id` and use it for a `make_payment` **Item Action** call. The `:id` is also referred to as a **token** when involving Credit Cards.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.ICardAccountsApiSync.CreateCardAccountWithHttpInfo(AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.CardAccountRequestBody)
member.summary: Create Card Account
member.remarks: Create a Credit **Card Account** to be used as a funding source. Store the returned `:id` and use it for a `make_payment` **Item Action** call. The `:id` is also referred to as a **token** when involving Credit Cards.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.ICardAccountsApiSync.RedactCardAccount(System.String)
member.summary: Redact Card Account
member.remarks: Redact a Credit **Card Account** using a given `:id`. Redacted Credit **Card Accounts** can no longer be used as a funding source.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: ID of the card account to be deleted

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.ICardAccountsApiSync.RedactCardAccountWithHttpInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Redact Card Account

member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: ID of the card account to be deleted

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.ICardAccountsApiSync.ShowCardAccount(System.String)
member.summary: Show Card Account
member.remarks: Show details of a specific Credit **Card Account** using a given `:id`. You can toggle the card account number display to show the first 6 digits in addition to the last 4 digits. Contact Assembly if you want to toggle the card account display.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: T:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IChargesApiSync
member.summary: Represents a collection of functions to interact with the API endpoints

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IChargesApiSync.CreateCharge(AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.ChargeRequestBody)
member.summary: Create Charge
member.remarks: Create a **Charge**. **Charges** require a specified **Card Account** or **Bank Account**. You may pass through an existing **User**, or define the `user_id` of the new user that will be associated with the **Charge** and the provided Account. The `user_id` can be left blank if you wish for a new user to be created for the **Charge**, or specified if you wish for a new **User** to be created with the passed `user_id`.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

You may pass through an existing **User**, or define the `user_id` of the new user that will be associated with the **Charge** and the provided Account. The `user_id` can be left blank if you wish for a new user to be created for the **Charge**, or specified if you wish for a new **User** to be created with the passed `user_id`.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.summary: Represents a collection of functions to interact with the API endpoints

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IFeesApiSync.CreateFee(AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.FeeRequestBody)
member.summary: Create fee
member.remarks: Create a **Fee** to be associated with an **Item**. **Fees** will add or subtract from the **Item** amount based on the **User**, payment type or Disbursement account type. **Fees** can be `Fixed` or `Percentage` based. **Fees** can be capped, have a maximum amount and/or a minimum amount.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: T:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IItemActionsApiSync
member.summary: Represents a collection of functions to interact with the API endpoints

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IItemActionsApiSync.AuthorizePayment(System.String,AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.CardAccountIdRequestBody)
member.summary: Authorize Payment
member.remarks: Where pre-authentication is enabled on a platform, initiates a credit card payment authorization for an item. When an authorization is successful, your platform holds the item amount for capture, but there is no transfer of funds happening. This call is used with the Capture Payment or Void Payment calls.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IItemActionsApiSync.AuthorizePaymentWithHttpInfo(System.String,AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.CardAccountIdRequestBody)
member.summary: Authorize Payment
member.remarks: Where pre-authentication is enabled on a platform, initiates a credit card payment authorization for an item. When an authorization is successful, your platform holds the item amount for capture, but there is no transfer of funds happening. This call is used with the Capture Payment or Void Payment calls.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IItemActionsApiSync.CancelItem(System.String)
member.summary: Cancel
member.remarks: Cancel an **Item**. This will transition the **Item** state to `cancelled`. **Items** can only be cancelled if they haven’t been actioned in any other way.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IItemActionsApiSync.CancelItemWithHttpInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Cancel
member.remarks: Cancel an **Item**. This will transition the **Item** state to `cancelled`. **Items** can only be cancelled if they haven’t been actioned in any other way.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IItemActionsApiSync.CapturePayment(System.String)
member.summary: Capture Payment
member.remarks: Where pre-authentication is enabled on a platform, completes a credit card payment for an item whose payment is authorized. This call is used with the Authorize Payment call.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IItemActionsApiSync.CapturePaymentWithHttpInfo(System.String)
member.summary: Capture Payment
member.remarks: Where pre-authentication is enabled on a platform, completes a credit card payment for an item whose payment is authorized. This call is used with the Authorize Payment call.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IItemActionsApiSync.MakePayment(System.String,AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.AccountIdRequestBody)
member.summary: Make Payment
member.remarks: Make a payment for an **Item**. Pass the `:account_id` of a **Bank Account** or a **Card Account** associated with the **Item’s** buyer. The **Item** state will transition to one of `payment_held`, `payment_pending` or `completed` for an **Express** or **Approve** payment type.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IItemActionsApiSync.MakePaymentWithHttpInfo(System.String,AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.AccountIdRequestBody)
member.summary: Make Payment
member.remarks: Make a payment for an **Item**. Pass the `:account_id` of a **Bank Account** or a **Card Account** associated with the **Item’s** buyer. The **Item** state will transition to one of `payment_held`, `payment_pending` or `completed` for an **Express** or **Approve** payment type.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IItemActionsApiSync.Refund(System.String,AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.RefundRequestBody)
member.summary: Refund
member.remarks: Refund an **Item**’s funds. A partial `amount` can be specified otherwise the full amount will be refunded. This will transition the **Item** state to ‘refunded’ if the full amount is refunded, or to the previously held state if a partial `amount` is specified.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: Marketplace / Platform item ID to be refunded

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IItemActionsApiSync.RefundWithHttpInfo(System.String,AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.RefundRequestBody)
member.summary: Refund
member.remarks: Refund an **Item**’s funds. A partial `amount` can be specified otherwise the full amount will be refunded. This will transition the **Item** state to ‘refunded’ if the full amount is refunded, or to the previously held state if a partial `amount` is specified.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: Marketplace / Platform item ID to be refunded

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IItemActionsApiSync.ReleasePayment(System.String,AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.ReleasePaymentRequestBody)
member.summary: Release Payment (Deprecated - Do Not Use)
member.remarks: Included for legacy purposes for existing customers that use Escrow payments which are no longer supported for new flows/customers. Release funds held in escrow from an **Item** with an **Escrow** or **Escrow Partial Release** payment type. This will transition the **Item** state to `completed`.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IItemActionsApiSync.ReleasePaymentWithHttpInfo(System.String,AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.ReleasePaymentRequestBody)
member.summary: Release Payment (Deprecated - Do Not Use)
member.remarks: Included for legacy purposes for existing customers that use Escrow payments which are no longer supported for new flows/customers. Release funds held in escrow from an **Item** with an **Escrow** or **Escrow Partial Release** payment type. This will transition the **Item** state to `completed`.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.summary: Void Payment
member.remarks: Where pre-authentication is enabled on a platform, voids the `payment_authorized` status for an item. This call is used with the Authorize Payment call. **Note**: Not all payment gateways support the Void Payment API call. In this case, you can wait until a payment authorization expires. A payment authorisation expires after 3 to 6 days if not captured.

member.remarks: Refund an **Item**’s funds. A partial `amount` can be specified otherwise the full amount will be refunded. This will transition the **Item** state to ‘refunded’ if the full amount is refunded, or to the previously held state if a partial `amount` is specified.

member.name: T:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.ITransactionsApiSync
member.summary: Represents a collection of functions to interact with the API endpoints

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.ITransactionsApiSync.ListTransactions(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: List Transactions
member.remarks: Retrieve an ordered and paginated list of **Transactions**. Note: `created_before` and `created_after` range can not be greater than 31 days
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200. (optional, default to 10)
Number of records to offset. Required for pagination. (optional, default to 0)
Bank, Card or Wallet Account ID. (optional)

The type of transaction. Options for querying are: payment, refund, disbursement, fee, deposit, withdrawal. For returned values please refer here: [Enumeration Values](https://developer.assemblypayments.com/docs/enumeration-values) for the full list (optional)

The method the transaction was carried out with. Options for querying are: credit_card, npp, bpay, wire_transfer, wallet_account_transfer, misc. For returned values please refer here: [Enumeration Values](https://developer.assemblypayments.com/docs/enumeration-values) for the full list (optional)
Date and time in ISO 8601 format the item(s) were created before (e.g. 2020-02-27T23:54:59Z) (optional)
Date and time in ISO 8601 format the item(s) were created after (e.g. 2020-02-27T23:54:59Z) (optional)

member.summary: List Transactions Retrieve an ordered and paginated list of **Transactions**. Note: `created_before` and `created_after` range can not be greater than 31 days
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call
member.param: Number of records to retrieve. Up to 200. (optional, default to 10)
Number of records to offset. Required for pagination. (optional, default to 0)
Bank, Card or Wallet Account ID. (optional)

The type of transaction. Options for querying are: payment, refund, disbursement, fee, deposit, withdrawal. For returned values please refer here: [Enumeration Values](https://developer.assemblypayments.com/docs/enumeration-values) for the full list (optional)

The method the transaction was carried out with. Options for querying are: credit_card, npp, bpay, wire_transfer, wallet_account_transfer, misc. For returned values please refer here: [Enumeration Values](https://developer.assemblypayments.com/docs/enumeration-values) for the full list (optional)
Date and time in ISO 8601 format the item(s) were created before (e.g. 2020-02-27T23:54:59Z) (optional)
Date and time in ISO 8601 format the item(s) were created after (e.g. 2020-02-27T23:54:59Z) (optional)

member.summary: Create User
member.remarks: Create a **User**. **Users** can be associated with **Items** either as a buyer or a seller. **Users** can’t be both the buyer and seller for the same **Item**. **Note**: Some parameters are required for user verification. See our guide on [Onboarding a Payout User/Seller](https://developer.assemblypayments.com/docs/onboarding-a-pay-out-user) for more information.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

member.name: M:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Api.IUsersApiSync.VerifyUser(System.String)
member.summary: Verify User (Prelive Only)
member.remarks: Sets a user’s verification state to `approved` on pre-live given the **User** `:id`. Ensure that a **User** has the required user verification information before using this call, otherwise the call will fail. **Note**: This API call will only work in our pre-live environment. The user verification workflow holds for all users in production.
member.exception: Thrown when fails to make API call

The user verification workflow holds for all users in production.

member.name: P:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Client.Configuration.ApiKeyPrefix
member.summary:
Gets or sets the prefix (e.g. Token) of the API key based on the authentication name.
Whatever you set here will be prepended to the value defined in AddApiKey.
An example invocation here might be:
ApiKeyPrefix["Authorization"] = "Bearer";
… where ApiKey["Authorization"] would then be used to set the value of your bearer token.
OAuth2 workflows should set tokens via AccessToken.
member.value: The prefix of the API key.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Name assigned by the platform/marketplace to identify the account (similar to a nickname) (required) (default to "My Water Bill Company").
The Biller Code for the biller that will receive the payment. The Biller Code must be a numeric value with 3 to 10 digits. (required).
Customer reference number (crn) to be used for this bpay account. The CRN must contain between 2 and 20 digits. (required) (default to "987654321").

Description of the Charge being created..
The cost being charged in cents. (required).
Email of the user associated with the account being charged. (required) (default to "buyer-1556505753@promisepay.com").
[ISO 3166-1 alpha-3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-3#Officially_assigned_code_elements) country code of the User being charged. (required) (default to "AUS").
A comma separated list of fee IDs to apply.

[ISO 4217 alpha-3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) currency code. This is an optional field and if not provided, the item will be created with the default currency of the marketplace..
True - Enables the account to be charged in the future. False - Redacts the account after this charge. .
Device Information for the device initiating the payment.
IP Information for the device initiating the payment.
When `custom_descriptors` are enabled, this is the information to appear on credit card and direct debit statements..

member.name: T:AssemblyPay.Sdk.Model.FeeRequestBody.ToEnum
member.summary: Who pays the Fee. Allowed values are (buyer or seller). If this field has a value of buyer, then the buyer will have to pay the fee on top of the actual payment (example for an item of 100 and a fee of 2, then the buyer would have to pay 102) If this field has a value of seller, then the seller will end up receiving the amount - the fee (example for an item of 100 and a fee of 2, then the seller would end up receiving 98)
member.value: Who pays the Fee. Allowed values are (buyer or seller). member.param: Fee type: 1. Fixed 2. Percentage 3. Percentage with Cap 4. Percentage with Min (required) (default to FeeTypeIdEnum._2).
Amount in cents; if the fee type is percentage, then this shows the percentage in hundredths (For example, an amount of 5 refers to 0.05% in fees.) (required) (default to 200).

Who pays the Fee. Allowed values are (buyer or seller). If this field has a value of buyer, then the buyer will have to pay the fee on top of the actual payment (example for an item of 100 and a fee of 2, then the buyer would have to pay 102) If this field has a value of seller, then the seller will end up receiving the amount - the fee (example for an item of 100 and a fee of 2, then the seller would end up receiving 98).

member.param: Unique ID that can be generated by the platform. Cannot contain ’.’ character. Contact Assembly support if you want item IDs to be generated automatically. (required) (default to "7190770-1-2908").

[ISO 4217 alpha-3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217#Active_codes) currency code. This is an optional field and if not provided, the item will be created with the default currency of the marketplace..
A comma separated list of fee IDs to apply.
Link for the buyer CTA (Call To Action).
Link for the seller CTA (Call To Action).
Toggle to generate tax invoice once Item is complete.
When `custom_descriptors` are enabled, this is the information to appear on credit card and direct debit statements..

State section of the user's driving license.

Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Unique ID that can be generated by the platform. Cannot contain ’.’ character. Contact Assembly support if you want user IDs to be generated automatically. (required) (default to "buyer-1556506027").
First name of the user (required) (default to "Neol1556506027").
Last name of the user (required) (default to "Calangi").
Email of the user. Unique to platform. (required) (default to "neol.calangi+buyer1556506027@promisepay.com").
International number format. Include ’+’ and no spaces..
First line of the user address.
Second line of the user address.
State section of the user address.
City section of the user address.
Generic parameter to capture important user verification data. eg. SSN for US users, TFN for AU users..
Driving license number of the user.
State section of the user's driving license.

When custom_descriptors are enabled, this is the information to appear on bundle direct debit statements (which show the buyer's custom_descriptor) as well as international wire payout, direct credit and PayPal payout statements (which show the seller's custom_descriptor).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A descriptor specified by the customer to be passed on the withdraw call. This requires that custom_descriptors are enabled. In the case of fast payments (AU / NPP) Assembly will append a value in the beginning of descriptor, the customer can use 200 characters (excluding URL, javascript/code, emojis). In the case of DE batch payments will allow 18 characters.
